author: sampo
title: Trading Tent: Multi-language
description: Tent was created to be a universal tool that anyone could utilize to safely trade Native Cardano Assets. For now, the product has been implemented in English, leaving non-English speakers vulnerable.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer wants to develop Tent-a trading application into a multilingual native asset trading tools and anyone can easily exchange NFT, ADA, Native Token directly between two people instantly and safe.

Technically, the team will create UX/UI suitable for each language including a FAQ and How To's transaction process to make it easy for users to understand and thereby avoid the risk of fraud and make transactions safer. Currently, the English version of the Tent application has 2.5 million ADA transactions. This proposer team will develop another 9 languages that are most used all over the world.

With trading Tent multi language, the application will attract more users from other parts of the world. Thereby helping people realize the benefits from the Cardano ecosystem. The proposal suits Fund9 challenge to build real-world solutions based on the Cardano blockchain.
f6_assessments.q1:
This project has great potential, bringing strong growth to investors about products developed on the Cardano platform. It helps to reach most of the largest user communities through 9 most spoken languages in the world. With a direct and safe way of trading without going through any 3rd parties, it will help Tent quickly gain an early foothold in the market of asset trading applications on Cardano's platform.

This proposal team including people with relevant experience in project implementation, they have UX/UI designers, marketing, product strategy, etc., In my opinion, the experience of UX/UI people will determine the great success of this project. Let's make it the best!

The budget used for this proposal is reasonable. Each item using the budget is listed clearly: UX/UI interface design, translation and product marketing activities to the community. 
The plan to implement this proposal is clear. Results of completing work are reported weekly and parallel execution between translation and technical implementation will help to shorten the time of the project. This is very reasonable and suitable for this project.
This is more than good that the proposer open possibility for Tent safe trading platform with more languages to the Cardano community in future.
f6_assessments.q2:
The roadmap is clear and described in detail. The translation and technical updates is carried out  in parallel with specific timelines, easy to follow and audit the results of the proposal.
The proposer is also dedicated a public site for anyone interested in auditing the progress of this proposal to be able to look at it at any moment. However, the link [https://catalyst.tradingtent.io] doesnot work yet or there is typing mistake from https://www.tradingtent.io/catalyst.

f6_assessments.q0: Reading through this proposal was very intriguing. There is a lot of information that is completely unique from other proposals I have read. This is an idea of a proposal that promotes complete utility for the Cardano blockchain and will likely bring more users to the Cardano ecosystem. The challenge identified by this proposal is that most of the programs are built in the English language. There are a couple of projects that have implemented other languages. However, it makes it more difficult for these users to navigate through and even find their native language. The proposed solution to this is that the Trading Tent team will continue to add 9 more languages onto their project. Their project allows for these dapps and wallets to be translated into different languages immediately. They plan to include the 9 largest and most widely used languages to increase the amount of activity on Cardano. This could lead to having a global impact on the Cardano blockchain because it will allow for more people around the world to comfortably use Cardano-based dapps and wallets. For these reasons, I give this section of the proposal 5 stars. I would love to see this be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q1: It is important to note that the team has included a lot of information on their team. Each team member has included their Linkedin profile and also provides their specific experience and skills. This is important because it shows that the team is willing to be held accountable to this project and ensure that their multi-language tool will be implemented successfully and will bring utility to all community members. There is a detailed roadmap that shows exactly when they plan to implement specific details. They plan to finish their product within 13 weeks. Every week or two there is specific information on what they will have accomplished. This is important because it gives specific details that the team can be held accountable for. They have included a detailed budget breakdown that supports their roadmap and project. Most of the funds will be allocated to translation services and tutorial videos for their project in these given 9 languages. I believe that this project will likely be implemented successfully given the specific details and the transparency from the team. This is regarding the information provided on each of their team members. For these reasons, I give this section of the proposal 5 stars.
f6_assessments.q2: There is a great deal of information provided in this proposal. It is exciting to see the innovation that this proposal could bring to the Cardano ecosystem by allowing more people of different nationalities and different cultures to utilize Cardano. There is specific information included in the plan, roadmap, and budget breakdown which is extremely important. All of the information matches up to what the proposal describes. I would imagine that a proposal like this has a lot of followers behind it. This is because there would be a lot of people that would love to have an easier time navigating the Cardano ecosystem by using their native language. The only suggestion I would make is to include more information about the current community behind this project and how the team plans to deal with the concept of accountability. The community should be aware of this proposal and idea. This will likely give the proposal more traction and a higher likelihood of being successful. Given this information, I give this section of the proposal 5 stars. I really would love to see this implemented successfully. If done correctly, we could see a lot more users coming onto Cardano and being more understanding of how their technology works.

f6_assessments.q0: Tent was created as a universal tool that anyone can use to trade Native Cardano Assets securely. As a result, non-English speakers have a language barrier that can prevent them from using the platform. Currently, over 10,000 assets and over ₳2.5 million have been traded through this platform. The translations would be in the following languages: Mandarin, Hindi, Spanish, French, Arabic, Filipino, Portuguese and Indonesian. This project can have a positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem as the multilingual implementation can provide a universal tool through which people around the world can securely trade Native Cardano Assets. The main goals correspond to the outlined challenges settings. The biggest risk will be to perform the correct translations for the technical parts. The submitter will only work with native speakers to provide the most accurate translation possible. The other challenge is to get the mobile version of Tent . (future proof, easy to update)
f6_assessments.q1: The team members with their relevant skills and experience are included in the proposal. You can check out these people's skills through their included website. Tent's core team will work on this, as will of course the translators for each language. The translators are currently not included yet. You can check the experience of these people via their linkedin. A breakdown of the budget is available. This budgeting is broken down into recognizable items. (translation services, marketing material,...) It would be useful to include working hours in the proposal. Now it seems quite common to charge $2,000 per language. The requested budget will be sufficient to implement the objectives. There will be a return for further financing or for a new project. A realistic timetable has been included to complete the work. It is good that the project is divided into 2 parallel phases and one implementation of both phases. The proposal provides a sensible implementation plan and shows what and how everything will be implemented. The submitter has included the challenges and risks. (technical risks and payment risks) The submitter has already taken into account to carry out this as well as possible.
f6_assessments.q2: A roadmap with milestones is included. This project has two parallel phases and one implementation of both phases. The milestones can certainly be reached within the requested time frame. The progress of this project will be shared via a public note on Trading Trent. This way everyone can follow the progress of this project. The team thus offers clear transparency towards the community. The submitter clearly describes the problem that a language barrier often prevents non-English speakers from accessing applications (Tent) to trade Native Cardano Assets securely. The proposer provides the solution by translating the Tent application into Mandarin, Hindi, Spanish, French, Arabic, Filipino, Portuguese and Indonesian. By doing so, these speakers also have easier access to this platform.

f6_assessments.q0: I rated this proposal a 4 because they effectively demonstrated the impact of moving forward with greater language capabilities and the need based on high usage. There’s a level of understandable simplicity for this proposal but I do think there are areas where the proposers can put some extra work to demonstrate impact. I think there’s a good argument to be made here that language expandability is a feature that encourages a widely safe experience for future adoption capabilities. Beyond potential missed opportunities to be a little creative with impacts, I would also like to see more numbers that help to understand the magnitude of this proposal. If there’s any research on Cardano users that might speak some of these languages, what countries they’re from, or IOG plans to expand into certain countries/languages, I think that information would help solidify that concrete vision about a post proposal world. Overall, this is a safe and relatively inexpensive proposal with great adoption and retention potential for the Cardano ecosystem because of Trading Tent’s greater security options.
f6_assessments.q1: I gave this a little bit of leeway and bumped up this section to a 4 because this seems perfectly reasonable to accomplish and at a reasonable cost breakdown. However, there are some gaps that would normally make me a little skeptical that can be easily fixed. Since many voters generally view feasibility through the lens of the development team, this proposal is in sort of a unique position. The core development team here doesn’t matter quite as much as the translators that are creating the end product of this proposal. I can understand translators not yet being onboarded but the service can get expensive and there needs to be at least some rationale or explanation regarding the plan on how to acquire these translators. I also think the scope of what needs to be translated needs to be further defined. The website at trading tent doesn’t seem to have a lot of content that needs to be translated, so there’s a question of whether or not those funds are efficiently spent. Lastly, the budget could use another layer of breakdown. I always love to see breakdown by hours of labor, cost per hour, and specific details on what every dollar is going to (most specifically the Multilanguage Implementation category). I’m entirely confident that they will be able to get the job done but these are the improvements I would suggest if another round is attempted.
f6_assessments.q2: Due to lack of objective measurable metrics, I rank this section a 3. In their defense, this is a very simple proposal that aims to accomplish a straightforward end goal. However, I always look for objective metrics and measurable KPIs and I do think there is an opportunity here to provide that. While I do think that completion of the proposal is an appropriate measurement of success here, a fully translated multi lingual Trading Tent platform makes no impact on the world unless it gets usage. Since the proposal budgeted for language specific marketing materials and tutorials, I assume they intend to spread awareness so I expect a preplanned perception of success in those endeavors. These metrics could include how many users from these languages adopt the platform, how much traffic the marketing and tutorial resources see, and maybe how many countries are reached (if this data is available). This section is one of the more important ones for me, so I hope to see much more thought put into what the proposer sees as success and in what timeframe they expect to see that end result.

f6_assessments.q0: Trading Tent is a platform that allows users to trade, sell and buy native Cardano assets. It has been live since January 2022 and is working stably on Cardano. After a while of working, the Trading Tent team proposes to develop a multi-language functionality for Trading Tent. Except for English, they will add some other popular languages like Mandarin, Hindi, Spanish, French, Arabic, Filipino, Portuguese, and Indonesian into Trading Tent. This will not only help more Cardano users access Trading Tent platform but also help Trading Tent platform grow and expand.
f6_assessments.q1: Trading Tent team will take on the project of adding multi-languages to the platform. If you use the Trading Tent platform and follow them, you will know that the team is also developing an NFT project called "Fort Gotten". Although they are still developing both projects on Cardano, they are doing very well. Obviously, they are an experienced team. According to the road map, they will conduct both translation creation and technical implementation in parallel. This process takes about 8 weeks. Then they spent two weeks implementing the translations and testing. Finally, they will spend a week allowing users to publicly submit, revise, and approve translations of their open language translation system. The cost they planned for the whole process in the road map is $34000. According to their calculation, I also agree that $34000 is reasonable for this project.
f6_assessments.q2: Although Trading Tent team offers the link "catalyst.tradingtent.io" for everyone to audit the progress of this proposal, I think they should also suggest other methods. For example, they should have key metrics to measure the effectiveness of their progress in adding multi-languages to Trading Tent platform. The language diversity of Trading Tent platform is a great advantage. It will help many users to use the platform, but the team needs to promote advertising so that many users know about it.

f6_assessments.q0:
Proposals fit the challenge. The project solves the problem of language differences when transacting, which can lead to some misunderstandings or unnecessary risks, even in cases of taking advantage of this to commit fraud.
Just like you said, projects like this always face the same difficulty that is how to create the most understandable translation, it creates a familiar feeling for the user, so the solution to cooperate with the natives you mentioned are reasonable.
This project has the goal of bringing convenience to users and resolving language differences, I have no opinion on this part, the amount of information provided is adequate, and it is comletely understandable the impact that the project provides.
f6_assessments.q1: Thank you for providing complete resume information and evidence of team members' experience. The team has extensive experience in these areas and members have had success in Tent. The route you gave is easy to understand, I think I already understand the amount of work that the team undertakes, just hope you add which members will be involved in which stage, it will help me understand how you manage assignment. I have no opinion on this part, simply because I already have the necessary information, about the required budget is reasonable, it is suitable for the scope of the project. I rate this part highly.
f6_assessments.q2: I have known about this Trading Tent project before and I have no concerns about the auditability of the project. I'm pretty confident I can access updates on project progress easily and the proposer is clear about this as well. The only thing in this section, this is a translation project, I recommend you conduct surveys on translation quality, which can be easily done on Google Forms, and then communicate back to the community. It will show you the quality of your translation, thereby pointing out shortcomings and correcting them.I hope you will listen to this little request of mine.

solution: We will develop a multilanguage functionality for Tent, making it easier for people from all over the world to trade Native Cardano Assets from Wallet to Wallet in their native language.
experience: Our team has developed Tent, a live trading system. Everyone can open a Tent using a compatible wallet and share the link so another user can join. We have traded over 10,000 assets and more than 2.5 Million ₳ through Trading Tent.
